channel.title: Online
channel.description: I'm trying to run my server off of my wifi and i logged in on my server and it seems to be connected from my ipv4 adress because it says "last connected from 10.0.0.3. I made a no-ip host and idk what to do. I'm portforwarded.

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“AliAbid, post:12, topic:536028”]Canyouseeme usually gives you false positives just like how it did to me, try pfportchecker from portforward.com[/quote]mate why would it give you a false positive… that makes no sense man

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

AliAbid:

Canyouseeme usually gives you false positives just like how it did to me, try pfportchecker from portforward.com

It’s never gave me a false positive. It usually does the exact opposite.
also, simpleportforwarder works amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @CreativityScape CreativityScape
item.description:
@CreativityScape wrote:

You gotta change the IP’s to your no-ip. Also, theres always 1 IP that has to be set to the IP you have right now.
http://whatismyipaddress.com/
http://canyouseeme.org/

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

okay so if i change the client ip to my no-ip will i not connect? I’m so sorry for the hastle im a noob as we all start somewhere. I figured it was offline because several people downloaded the client and not one connected. heres a picture if this helps

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well how are you (or the person getting error connected) logging in the server? If you’re on the same machine as the server, you have to have the client IP at 127.0.01 (localhost). If you’re on the same network, the client IP needs to be the host computers IPv4 address, if you’re on another network, use your IP address found here or no-ip, but your real ip is more reliable.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

i know mate. The server was on, and it says it can see my port at 43594 and the client still says error connecting.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

cammyPVPftw:

i dont really know, i set my client to my no-ip host and i check to see if my port 43594 is open but it still doesnt want to connect.

Turn the server on, and then go to http://canyouseeme.org and check if 43594 is visible.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @cammyPVPftw cammyPVPftw
item.description:
@cammyPVPftw wrote:

i dont really know, i set my client to my no-ip host and i check to see if my port 43594 is open but it still doesnt want to connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ky sorcerer:

your ipv4 login is specified to the wifi itself, it can change every now and then. Every time i restart my pc it will change the IPV4 adress therefore that doesnt really matter.

Make you ipv4 static then, it’s really not hard.

xx matty xx:

You should probably just upgrade to ipv6… it’s not 2003 anymore.

No one has switched over from 4 to 6 yet, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It tells you your last connected IP. Since you’re on localhost, the last connected IP is either your ipv4 or localhost, or at least normally. That doesn’t mean your server isn’t online.

Read full topic
